It is also plausible that testosterone might reduce the need for assisted ventilation through its anticatabolic effect on respiratory muscles.
27 A recent study found that hypogonadism was common in mechanically ventilated patients with acute respiratory failure and was strongly associated with longer intensive care unit stays.
28 Several small-scale clinical studies indicate that testosterone therapy may improve outcomes in hospitalized patients with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease.
29 Further research is needed on this potential effect.
